private_information: I observe and reason about subsets of blocks: A B C D E F G
I know the Blocks World rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time
agent_alpha.goal: Track and report the state changes for the blocks I observe after the given action sequence and produce a consistent partial state representation.

private_information: I observe and reason about subsets of blocks: H I J K L M N
I know the Blocks World rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time
agent_beta.goal: Track and report the state changes for the blocks I observe after the given action sequence and produce a consistent partial state representation.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the partial states reported by the agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner that represents the final block arrangement.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World domain with blocks A B C D E F G H I J K L M N
Only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time

Initial arrangement of blocks: A is on top of H, B is on top of F, C is on the table, D is on top of C, E is on top of J, F is on top of L, G is on top of D, H is on the table, I is on top of N, J is on top of K, K is on top of A, L is on top of E, M is on top of G, N is on top of M
In other words the initial stacks from table upward are: Stack1: H A K J E L F B, Stack2: C D G M N I, plus any singletons as appropriate

An explicit ordered action sequence will be executed by the agents. Each action follows standard Blocks World operators: unstack(X,Y) means remove top X from Y, stack(X,Y) means place X onto Y, pickup(X) means pick X from table, putdown(X) means put X to table

observe.system_prompt: You are agent_alpha. You do not need to produce PDDL. Using the public information and your private information, process the provided action sequence and produce a precise, stepwise state report for the blocks you are responsible for. Report final relations for each of your blocks using simple predicate-like assertions of the form on(X,Y) or ontable(X). Do not invent actions or assume extra blocks beyond those listed. If an action in the sequence does not affect your observed blocks, note that there is no change.

You are agent_beta. You do not need to produce PDDL. Using the public information and your private information, process the provided action sequence and produce a precise, stepwise state report for the blocks you are responsible for. Report final relations for each of your blocks using simple predicate-like assertions of the form on(X,Y) or ontable(X). Do not invent actions or assume extra blocks beyond those listed. If an action in the sequence does not affect your observed blocks, note that there is no change.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent Blocks World and PDDL modeling targeted to run with the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the partial state reports from the agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the Blocks World domain and the final arrangement of blocks after the given action sequence. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure typing and predicates are compatible with standard STRIPS-like FastDownwards usage. Keep agent actions distinct if modeling multi-agent actions, but the main requirement is a correct domain and a problem representing the final state as the goal state for verification with FastDownwards. Do not include any escape sequences in your output.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the agents' reports and the public information to create a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the FastDownwards solver. The public information includes the explicit initial arrangement and the executed action sequence. Use the agents' state reports as inputs to determine the final configuration. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
